p: Compared to the first decade of the study period analyzed, the second (2009–2018) saw a reduction in the number of sting-related fatal cases in: Andalucía, Aragón, Castilla y León, Cataluña, Valencia, Extremadura, and Madrid; and the opposite trend with an increase in X23 MR in: Asturias, Balearic Islands, Castilla-La Mancha, Galicia, Murcia, and Pais Vasco. Out of the total Spanish beehive stock, 21.8% (15.4 hives/km 2; 58.3 hives/100 inhabitants), 19.6% (6.4 hives/km 2; 6.7 hives/100 inhabitants), 15.3% (4.7 hives/km 2; 18.2 hives/100 inhabitants), and 12.5% (15.4 hives/km 2; 7.2 hives/100 inhabitants) are distributed in Extremadura, Andalusia, Castilla y León, and Valencia, respectively [ 52].
